page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {BATHFORD A village of some 400 houses:mainly built on hill overlooking River Avon.Has been settlement for over 1000 yrs.Mentioned in Domesday Book. Parish includes:- { 1.WARLEIGH MANOR}-Hugoline,Lord of manor,lawyer, appointed by William 1st to write first Domesday Book. { 2.BROWN'S FOLLY}-Tower built to provide work for unemployed in district by Wade Brown in 1849.Local landmark. { 3.SALLY IN THE WOODS -}Part of hill named after so called witch who lived in lodge by wood.Reputed to have flown up chimney on broomstick. { 4.BATHFORD PAPER MILL}-Treasury notes were once made here. { 5.WHITEHAVEN HOUSE}-period house built by Wood in 1748.Once known as {Titan Barrow.
